North_Charleston.Charles Towne Landing:
Charles Towne Landing State Historic Site preserves the original site of the first permanent English settlement in Carolina. Originally opened in 1970 to commemorate South Carolina's tricentennial, this 664-acre (269 ha) site is home to an exhibit hall, rental facility, a natural habitat zoo, ongoing archeological excavations, miles of trails, dozens of picnic tables, a replica tall ship, six fireable replica cannon, and much more.


== Living history ==


=== Experimental Crop Garden ===
The Experimental Crop Garden showcases crops planted by early colonists for food and profit.
